title: Battletoads, Ninja Gaiden II, And More Come To Nintendo Switch Online
content: Nintendo Switch Online’s NES and Game Boy libraries got a new pair of games each today, the former for the first time in nearly a year. Battletoads and Ninja Gaiden II: The Dark Sword of Chaos are now available for the NES library, while the Game Boy collection gets Bionic Commando and Kid Icarus: Of Myths and Monsters   Battletoads, first released in 1991, is both beloved and infamous as a classic and challenging co-op brawler. Developed by Rare, it’s now technically owned by Xbox as well. Ninja Gaiden II: The Dragon Sword arrived in 1990 as the second entry of the NES trilogy of Ninja Gaiden games. You may be surprised to know that it’s a very hard game. The Game Boy version of Bionic Commando was released in 1992 as a largely faithful port of the NES original. Its arrival on Nintendo Switch Online marks its first-ever re-release. 1991’s Kid Icarus: Of Myths and Monsters is the Game Boy exclusive sequel to Kid Icarus, and would be the last entry in the series until 2012’s Kid Icarus: Uprising. If you’ve lost track of what’s available on the Nintendo Switch Online’s various classic games libraries, be sure to check out our complete database of every game on the service . Source: Game Informer

title: Bungie Shares Deep Dive On Star Wars-Inspired Destiny 2: Renegades
content: Bungie today offered a deep dive look at the new Destiny 2: Renegades release, which is scheduled to arrive for players next week, on December 2. The new major release for the game is an unusual one, as it’s rooted in a partnership with Star Wars. A quick look through the early visuals of the game don’t leave much room for doubt on that, as there are lots of things that look like lightsabers, stormtroopers, and villainous Sith. But as today’s vidoc makes clear, Bungie is trying to thread a more nuanced line with this release that it first appears. While plenty of features may look like Star Wars, the team is going to great pains to make sure it remains a true and canon Destiny experience. Those aren’t lightsabers but rather Praxic Blades. Those aren’t stormtroopers but instead members of the surging Barant Imperium. And that’s not a Sith – it’s a dangerous new big bad named Dredgen Bael. Whether the developer can pull off keeping those distinctions or not will be a matter to decide once we can play the game, but the early descriptions and footage offer good reason to be excited. The storyline appears to focus strongly on Drifter as a central character, acting as a conduit into some of the criminal underworld of the solar system. With his scoundrel demeanor, Drifter pretty clearly nods a bit toward characters like Han Solo in the Star Wars fiction. We also get to know a character that has been mentioned in the past in written lore entries for Destiny. Aunor Mahal is about as close as the game is likely to have to a Jedi, with her Praxic Blade that she is using to fight against Dredgen Bael. Players will pledge to a faction and build up reputation as they fight across the Lawless Frontier, an explorable space with a dedicated social hub in the form of Tharsis Outpost. Factions include the anarchist Eliksni biker gang called The Pikers, the group of sentient Vex call the Tharsis Reformation, and the rogue Cabal called Totality Division. You’ll run jobs for these factions like smuggling, bounty hunts, and sabotage-focused missions. While Aunor is shown in some pretty slick lightsaber-esque battles, NPCs aren’t the only people getting fun new Star Wars-themed toys to play with. Players will also be able to wield Praxic Blades, and will even be able to try out different fighting styles, very much like a Jedi. With the exotic primary, kinetic Praxic Blade, you can deflect attacks, melee attack enemies, and even throw. And, just to set clear expectations, Bungie has shared that the Praxic Blade won’t be unique to this content drop; it will continue to be a relevant weapon in future expansions to the game. Renegades also introduces new Blasters inspired by Star Wars, including several distinct variants, from dynamic blasters that hit harder with brute force, to more fast-firing balanced blasters. Blasters overheat and must cool down, rather than have a traditional magazine reload. We also learned about a special solar exotic crossbow called Heirloom, inspired by Chewbacca’s weapon in the movies. Players will also be able to pick up different “renegade abilities,” that seem in some way to tie together with the faction you work for. Across all the new content Bungie showed off today, one of the features that stood out the most was the music. By drawing direct inspiration from the Star Wars scores, arguably some of the most extensively varied and beloved of all film music, the new Destiny themes that were part of this preview presentation were, quite simply, riveting. The Renegades experience may be worth returning to play if only to hear more of that great music in action. There’s plenty more to learn in the complete rundown. Check out the full vidoc below to get a comprehensive look at what Bungie is cooking up. Destiny 2 continues its march into the future with Renegades on December 2. Source: Game Informer

title: Yuji Horii On Final Fantasy: 'When I First Saw Final Fantasy X, I Recall Feeling This Was The Ultimate Perfection'
content: Dragon Quest launched in Japan in 1986, and a little over a year later, Final Fantasy launched in 1987. Though the two are now sister RPG franchises at Square Enix, before the 2003 merger between Square and Enix, these series were competitors. And if you ask fans, they might use a word like rivals.  I traveled to Tokyo, Japan, last month to visit Square Enix’s Shibuya offices, play Dragon Quest VII Reimagined , and interview the team behind the remake for Game Informer’s latest cover story . But as part of this trip, I interviewed Dragon Quest creator Yuji Horii for 90 minutes about all kinds of topics, including the aforementioned competition between his franchise and Final Fantasy. He didn’t call it “competition,” as I did, but admits, “I was definitely paying attention to it.” “Way back then, when Final Fantasy originally came out, I was definitely paying attention to it because it was something we needed to look out for,” Horii tells me. “But there’s one key difference that I really saw back then: the protagonists in the Final Fantasy titles, they speak a lot. Whereas for Dragon Quest, the key objective for [the games], or the experience it offers for the player, is that the player becomes the protagonist themselves. “In Final Fantasy, you kind of observe the protagonist, but you’re not necessarily becoming the protagonist in the games. So I thought that was a really interesting and stark difference between Dragon Quest and Final Fantasy, but I didn’t necessarily see them as a rival back then.” Horii says in Dragon Quest, protagonists don’t “just start talking on their own.” “Final Fantasy, again, [the protagonists] just talk a lot,” he continues. “I do like Final Fantasy, though. When I first saw Final Fantasy X, I recall feeling this was the ultimate perfection of Final Fantasy.” Great taste, Horii. Dragon Quest VII Reimagined launches on February 5 on PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X/S, Switch 2, Switch, and PC. In the meantime, check out this article breaking down everything in the Dragon Quest VII Reimagined issue of Game Informer , and be sure to subscribe here if you haven’t yet to access the Dragon Quest VII Reimagined cover story , our deep dive into Dragon Quest history with creator Yuji Horii, and so much more. Source: Game Informer

title: FX Announces Far Cry Anthology Series Coming To Hulu From Alien: Earth And It's Always Sunny Creators
content: FX is developing an anthology TV series adapting Ubisoft’s Far Cry franchise. The upcoming show will stream on Hulu in the U.S. and Disney+ internationally. According to a press release, the series will “retain Far Cry’s signature standalone storytelling format” and each season will take place in a new setting and star a different cast. Far Cry is being helmed by executive producers Noah Hawley, creator of FX’s Fargo and Alien: Earth , and Rob Mac (formerly McElhenney after a legal name change this summer), creator of It’s Always Sunny in Philadelphia . Mac, who also co-wrote and stars in the FX docuseries Welcome to Wrexham and Apple TV’s Mythic Quest, will join the cast of Far Cry in the starring role. “What I love about the Far Cry game franchise is it’s an anthology. Each game is a variation of a theme, the same way each season of Fargo is a variation on a theme,” said Hawley in a press release. “To create a big action show that can change from year to year, while always exploring the nature of humanity through this complex and chaotic lens is a dream come true. I’m excited to partner with Rob and bring our shared irreverent, ambitious sensibility to the screen.” “Getting to work alongside Noah Hawley is a dream realized,” said Rob Mac in a press release. “Ubisoft has been remarkably generous, entrusting us with one of the most iconic video-game worlds ever created. And through it all, my FX family continues to lift me up with their constant belief and support.” Far Cry 6 Far Cry ’s executive producer credits also include names from various production companies, such as Emilia Serrano (26 Keys), Nick Frenkel (3 Arts), Jackie Cohn (More Better), and John Campisi. Ubisoft Film & Television executives Gerard Guillemot, John Campisi, Margaret Boykin, and Austin Dill are also involved. FX’s Far Cry has no premiere date or announced cast besides Rob Mac. Whether it’s the 2010 Prince of Persia film or the 2016 Assassin’s Creed film, Ubisoft has never been shy about bringing its franchises to the big and small screens. Far Cry already has a TV show to its name in the form of 2023’s Captain Laserhawk: A Blood Dragon Remix , an adaptation of Far Cry 3: Blood Dragon. There is also the terrible 2008 Uwe Boll Far Cry film, but perhaps that is best forgotten. Other recent Ubisoft adaptations include a live-action Assassin’s Creed series currently in development by Netflix, and the animated show Splinter Cell: Deathwatch , which premiered on Netflix in October, is nominated for a Best Adaptation trophy for this year’s Game Awards . For more on Far Cry, you can read our review of its most recent entry, 2021’s Far Cry 6, here . Source: Game Informer

title: Best Gogma Artian Weapons to Craft in Monster Hunter Wilds
content: With the release of Title Update 4 in Monster Hunter Wilds , players will find a ton of new ways to make builds and expand upon what they can utilize to hunt monsters. Gogmazios is the game’s first Elder Dragon, but it also adds more customization options for the Artian Weapon system that is available for you to use.

title: Lost Ark Winter 2026 Roadmap: New Class, Raids, Balance Changes, QoL Improvements
content: Once one of the biggest MMORPGs on the planet, Lost Ark continues to strive thanks to its dedicated userbase. Released almost four years ago in the west, Lost Ark has gone from the highs of over a million concurrent players to a much more concentrated number of players, but ones that help keep the free-to-play model running. With 2025 coming to a close, Amazon Games has released their upcoming roadmap for the game. While it doesn’t go into every little detail we can expect over the coming months, it highlights some of the bigger events that we will see.

title: How to Get La Noscean Shorthair Cat and Gallant Shepherd in FFXIV
content: Every major Final Fantasy XIV patch comes with more or less what we’ve come to expect from the MMORPG. A handful of story quests, a new dungeon and trial, additional cosmetics and, of course, minions and mounts. The latter has become slightly less important to players over the years, but it still makes up for a good portion of the population looking to collect every little critter they can, along with riding every mount they can get their hands on. With patch 7.4 in Dawntrail , we receive a dynamic duo of cat and dog minions, specifically named the La Noscean Shorthair and Gallant Sheperd.

title: How to Quickly Cap Tomestones in FFXIV
content: The cycle of content is pretty straightforward in Final Fantasy XIV , and the most recent expansion, Dawntrail , it’s not much different. We are given new gear to trade in with a currency called Tomestones, something that has been with the game for roughly ten years now, and for the most part it has worked.

title: Transport Fever 3: Build Your Ultimate Transportation Empire
content: Have you ever wanted to be in charge of a transport empire? In Transport Fever 3 , fans of the tycoon genre will be able to build the network that drives the world, according to developer Urban Games. Transport Fever 3 received its first in-game trailer back in October, as it can be wishlist now on multiple platforms. The game will be available on PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X|S and PC in 2026. A new First Look Deep Dive Trailer has released today to give a better scope into what to expect with Transport Fever 3. This is the third Episode detailing the game.

title: Everdark Sovereign Balancers (Harmonia) Boss Guide in Elden Ring Nightreign
content: With the release of The Forsaken Hollows DLC for Elden Ring Nightreign , we saw two new final day bosses, along with a slew of other content. This includes a new massive map, weapons, two characters and much more. While players are still digging through the challenging boss fights , FromSoftware did something no one expected: they released the Everdark Sovereign version of one of the new bosses. Why this is surprising is because the Japanese studio has been cycling the other Night Lords in the past, slowly introducing them as new content. Instead, FromSoftware didn’t wait around and instead created a newly revamped version of the Balancers' expedition right away.

title: Where to Find the Command Panel Feature in FFXIV
content: With the release of patch 7.4 for Final Fantasy XIV , we received massive changes and improvements to the overall quality of life. While the core cycle of raids, story and dungeons remain mostly the same, Square Enix has introduced some long-awaited and well-deserved features. One of them happens to be the Command Panel, something a lot of players have been getting around by various means with macros. Thankfully, those are no longer needed as your HUD can look a lot cleaner now.

title: All Final Fantasy XIV PVP Series 10 Rewards
content: Every four months, a completely new PVP Series is released within Final Fantasy XIV , and with it comes a slew of new rewards. For patch 7.4, we got some very impressive rewards along with even more new content, even though it mostly comes in the form of a new map and mode. With that said, we’re here to show you everything you can get in Series 10 and what’s the best way to earn EXP to obtain them.

title: Xelios Boss Guide in Metroid Prime 4: Beyond
content: The Volt Forge is one of the first major locations Samus will have to visit in order to kick off her journey in Metroid Prime 4: Beyond . It’s a vital location that will not only get her the Vi-O-La suit and bike, but also, at the end, the ability to double jump. While there’s more to find in this location, especially coming back after completing it, there is a final boss to the area, specifically named Xelios. This is a giant electrical orb that’s one of the first major tests of the player, being able to chip away at its outer shell to destroy its core. We have the best ways to take care of this oversized orb.

title: Can PS1 Controllers Work On PS2?
content: With PlayStation, Sony introduced a revolutionary way to enjoy games that were now in full 3D and featured huge FMV cutscenes for a more cinematic experience. To navigate through this exciting new world gamers used the brand-new controller that had a D-pad with 4 face buttons (X, square, triangle, circle). It even had triggers for your middle fingers, something that every prior controller had lacked. But can PS1 controllers work on PS2? Yes, they will work on PS2 because both PS1 and PS2 controllers share the same port and basic control layout. Because PS2 uses a PS1 CPU as its I/O chip, it can perfectly read inputs from a PS1 controller and can even read PS1 memory cards . If you connect your PS1 controller to a PS2, make sure you’re not using it for a game that requires the DualShock. If the game doesn’t need analog sticks, you can play it just fine with a PS1 controller. Another thing to remember is that the PS1 controller doesn’t have pressure-sensitive buttons, while the DualShock does. PS1 Controller vs PS2 Controller If you open up both controllers you’ll see that they share much of the same basic circuitry with two exceptions. Firstly, the DualShock has two analog sticks and rumble motors. Secondly, it has pressure-sensitive buttons that are used by a small group of games such as Gran Turismo. What this means is that you can control the throttle and brake in Gran Turismo using just the X and square button rather than the right analog stick. This feature didn’t stick around for too long because it had more downsides than upsides. For example, people often found themselves slowing down in racing games just because they slightly lifted off on the X button. These days, the only pressure-sensitive parts of a controller are the triggers (L2 and R2). PlayStation 1’s controller had none of these fancy features, it didn’t have a rumble motor or analog sticks. Yet, games were designed around these limitations until the upgrade controller with analog sticks arrived in 1997. You don’t have to do anything special to make a PS1 controller work on PS2. Just plug it in like a DualShock and insert your PS1 disc into the tray. PS2 can also read PS1 memory cards (these will only work with PS1 games, not with PS2 games). Is A PS2 Controller Compatible With A PS1? Here’s the fun part- not only does a PS1 controller work flawlessly on PS2, but a PS2 controller will also work flawlessly on PS1. Because the controllers are so similar in how they process and send inputs, you can use them on either console. Just keep in mind the fact that many PS2 games require analog sticks so you can’t play them with a PS1 controller. What Controllers Work On A PS2? In addition to PS1 and DualShock controllers, PS2 can also support a small group of third-party controllers. The Logitech Wireless Action Controller is officially licensed and built quite well. You can also purchase modern 3 rd party controllers for your PS2, such as this one from Blue Lake Performance. Do PS1 Controllers Work On PS3? The DualShock 3 works perfectly for playing PS1 games on PS3, but you can’t use the original PS1 controllers. PS3 has USB ports rather than the old controller ports, which are used primarily for charging the wireless DualShock 3. If you want, you can purchase an adapter that makes PS1/ PS2 controllers work on PS3. Which PS2 Model Plays PS1 Games? All of them, because PS2’s I/O chip is just a PS1 CPU. Normally this works as a controller for the front ports, DVD drive, rear expansion slot, etc. But if a PS1 disc is detected, this I/O chip switches into backward compatibility mode. Did PS1 Have Joysticks? Not originally, but it got upgraded controllers in 1997 called Dual Analog. Eventually, this developed into the DualShock which would be used on PlayStation 2. Because Sony hadn’t quite figured out a durable enough rumble system, they removed rumble from the European and American releases of the Dual Analog controller. Thankfully, this feature was put back into DualShock for PS2. Conclusion I hope this article helped you understand more about the backward compatibility of PS2 with PS1 controllers. You can connect a PS1 controller to a PS2 as long as the game doesn’t require a DualShock. Some games even use the pressure-sensitive buttons of DualShock 2 and won’t work with a regular DualShock. For those who aren’t aware, the DualShock is an improved version of the Dual Analog controller that was originally released in 1997 for PS1. It added rumble, and the DualShock 2 is a DualShock with pressure-sensitive face buttons. Because it uses the same protocol as a PS1 controller, a PS2 controller can be connected to the PS1. If you found this article useful, you may want to save this pin below to your Gaming board.

title: Cüce Demirci Olduğumuz Medieval Crafter: Blacksmith Türkiye’ye Özel Fiyatla Çıktı
content: Compact Core imzalı Medieval Crafter: Blacksmith, Türkiye’ye özel fiyat etiketiyle Steam Erken Erişim’de yerini aldı. Daha önce Barista Simulator ve BBQ Simulator oyunlarını geliştiren Compact Core Games, yayıncılığını GameDev.ist’in üstlendiği M edieval Crafter: Blacksmith ile oyuncuları bir cüce demirci olmaya davet ediyor. 22 Eylül’de Steam’de yerini alacak olan oyunda hem günlük araç gereçler dövüyor hem de kudretli silahları can veriyoruz. Silah atölyemizde dövdüğümüz silah ve zırhları görev temelli bir oynanış döngüsüyle satmak da mümkün. Oyunun en ilginç yanlarından biri ise üretim simülasyonunu, bağımlılık yapıcı bir yönetim döngüsüyle birleştirmesinde yatıyor. Oyunda dövdüğümüz güçlü silahları doğrudan satmak yerine kahramanlarla anlaşıp, onları giydirebiliyoruz. Ekipmanlarımızla bizzat kuşattığımız kahramanları daha sonra görevlere gönderiyor ve bu görevlerden ganimet, yeni silah şemaları ve kıymetli malzemeler elde ediyoruz. Medieval Crafter: Blacksmith bu yönüyle hem zanaat simülasyonu hem de yönetim elementlerini sevenler için ideal. Çıkışına saatler kala 32.000 istek listesine ulaşan yapım, Türkiye’ye özel fiyat etiketiyle çıkış yapacak. Üstelik %20’lik çıkış indirimiyle çok daha cazip bir fiyat etiketine dönüşüyor. Medieval Crafter: Blacksmith 30.000 İstek Listesinde! Erken Erişim etiketiyle çıkan yapım ilerleyen süreçte atölyeyi düzenleme ve genişletme gibi yeni güncellemelerle buluşacak. Otomasyon elementini de oyuna kazandırmak isteyen geliştirici ekip, ham maddeleri toplamak için atölyemizde işçi çalıştırmamızı sağlayarak, farklı formüller ile oynanışı derinleştirmeyi hedefliyor. Birçok Erken Erişim oyununda olduğu gibi Compact Core Games de bu süreçte oyuncuların geri bildirimlerine de ihtiyaç duyacak. Eğer Medieval Crafter: Blacksmith’i geliştiricilerle birlikte tam sürüme taşımak isterseniz, oyunun Discord sunucusuna katılabilirsiniz. The post Cüce Demirci Olduğumuz Medieval Crafter: Blacksmith Türkiye’ye Özel Fiyatla Çıktı appeared first on SaveButonu .

title: Kingdom: Flames of War ile Mobil’de Benzersiz MMORPG Deneyimi Başladı
content: Kingdom: Flames of War mobil oyun dünyasında yepyeni bir çağ başlatıyor. PC kalitesinde MMORPG deneyimini mobil cihazlarımıza getiren Kingdom: Flames of War, devasa açık dünyası, çoklu dil desteği ve 300vs300 kale savaşları ile türünün sınırlarını ileriye taşıyor. Devasa Açık Dünyada Amansız Bir Macera Beş ayrı dilde yayınlanan Kingdom: Flames of War , tüm oyuncuları bir araya getirerek gerçek zamanlı bir MMORPG deneyimi sunuyor. Açık dünyada boss savaşları, dinamik PvP karşılaşmaları ve canlı oyun içi ekonomisi ile PC oyunları kadar detaylı ve nitelikli bir oyun keyfi mobil cihazlara taşınıyor. Oyuncular 300’e 300 kişilik devasa kale kuşatmalarında savaşın kalbine girerek strateji ve takım ruhunu ön plana çıkarabiliyor. Çeşitli Sınıflar, Karakter Dönüşümleri ve Yoldaş Petler Oyuncular kendi oyun tarzlarına uygun olacak şekilde; Savaşçı , Okçu , Suikastçı , Büyücü ve Lensiyer gibi farklı sınıflardan birini seçerek maceraya atılabiliyor. Her bir sınıf, kendine özgü savaş stili ve taktiksel avantajlarıyla da öne çıkıyor. Kingdom: Flames of War ’un gelişmiş karakter dönüşüm sistemi sadece gücü artırmakla kalmıyor, aynı zamanda farklı görünümler ve kişiselleştirme seçenekleri de sunuyor. Ayrıca maceranızda size eşlik edecek sevimli ve güçlü yoldaş petler de bu yolculukta oyuncuya güç katıyor. Çok Dilli Destek ve Global Topluluk Kingdom: Flames of War ’un birçok farklı dilde yayınlanması sayesinde ( Türkçe , İngilizce , Almanca , Fransızca ve Arapça ) dünyanın dört bir yanındaki oyuncular da bir araya geliyor. Böylelikle oyuncular global ittifaklar kurabiliyor, ticaret yapabiliyor ve farklı coğrafyalardan gelen oyuncularla aynı saflarda savaşabiliyorlar. İzmir merkezli geliştirici ve yayıncı BYTE , Kore merkezli FOW Games iş birliğiyle bu projeyi Türkiye , MENA ve Avrupa ’da oyuncularla buluşturuyor. Royale Online gibi popüler MMORPG ’lerin yapımcısı BYTE , mobil kanadında geniş ölçekli MMORPG deneyimi sunma konusundaki kararlılığını Kingdom: Flames of War ile bir kez daha gösteriyor. Kingdom: Flames of War’ı Hemen İndirin Mobil MMORPG ’nin iddialı oyunları arasında yerini şimdiden alan Kingdom: Flames of War 28 Ağustos ’ta oyun severlerle buluştu. Tüm dünyadaki oyunculara eş zamanlı olarak kapılarını açan oyun, Google Play Store ve App Store ’da mevcut. Oyunu hemen buraya tıklayarak indirebilirsiniz. The post Kingdom: Flames of War ile Mobil’de Benzersiz MMORPG Deneyimi Başladı appeared first on SaveButonu .

title: Medieval Crafter: Blacksmith’in Çıkış Tarihi Belli Oldu
content: Yerli stüdyo Compact Core Games tarafından geliştirilen, yayıncı koltuğunda ise GameDev.ist’in oturduğu Medieval Crafter: Blacksmith’in çıkış tarihi belli oldu. Gerçekçi demircilik mekanikleri ile dikkat çeken ve bizleri kahramanlar, büyülü güçler ve daha nicesiyle dolu fantastik diyarlara götürecek oyun erken erişim olarak yayınlanacak. Demirciliğin Her Aşaması Parmaklarımızın Ucunda Orta çağın mistik atmosferine demircilik zanaatında ustalaşmış bir cüce olarak adım attığımız Medieval Crafter: Blacksmith oyuncuları bir diyarın kaderini ateş ve çekiçle şekillendirmeye davet ediyor. Kahramanların büyük zaferlerinde yanlarında olacak kılıç ve zırhlardan, diyar halkının kullanacağı basit aletlere kadar pek çok farklı nesne üretebildiğimiz Medieval Crafter: Blacksmith ’in en dikkat çeken yanlarından biri de tüm demircilik süreçlerinin gerçeğe uygun biçimde işliyor oluşu. Madenleri eritmekten kalıplara dökmeye, kızgın materyali çekiçle döverek şekillendirmekten aletleri birleştirip son hallerine getirmeye kadar her bir aşamayı deneyimlememize olanak sağlayan oyunun vadettikleri yalnızca bunlarla da sınırlı değil. Ocağınızın başından ayrılmaya karar verip sizin adınıza görevlere çıkan kahramanlarınızla ilgilenebilir, mekanınızı özelleştirebilir, madenlerden kaynak materyal toplayabilir ve daha pek çok farklı maceraya atılabilirsiniz. Medieval Crafter: Blacksmith’in Çıkış Tarihi Duyuruldu Merakla beklenen oyunun çıkış tarihi de nihayet belli oldu. Compact Core Games tarafından geliştirilen ve yayıncılığını GameDev.ist ’in üstlendiği Medieval Crafter: Blacksmith, 22 Eylül 2025 tarihinde erken erişim olarak oyuncularla buluşmaya hazırlanıyor. Oyun Türkçe haricinde 12 dilde daha tüm dünyadaki oyuncuların karşısına çıkacak. Oyuna bir göz atmak ve istek listenize eklemek için buradaki linki kullanarak Medieval Crafter: Blacksmith ‘in Steam sayfasını ziyaret edebilirsiniz. Şayet “ben o kadar bekleyemem” diyorsanız da Steam’de oyunun ücretsiz demo versiyonunu deneyimleyebileceğinizi hatırlatalım. title: Yetimhane Öyküleri: Lost Lullabies: The Orphanage Chronicles Steam’de Çıktı
content: Pugsy Studios imzalı 4-kişilik co-op korku oyunu Lost Lullabies: The Orphanage Chronicles, Steam Erken Erişim’de çıktı. Gerçek hikâyelerden esinlenen oyunda yanmış bir yetimhanede ruhların kim olduğunu tespit ediyoruz. İsterseniz tek başınıza, isterseniz de arkadaşlarınızla oynayabileceğiniz Lost Lullabies’da temel döngüyü zenginleştiren birçok teçhizat ve atlatması güç korku dolu anlar var. Lost Lullabies: The Orphanage Chronicles nasıl bir oyun? Lost Lullabies, bizleri Lowell kasabasına götürüyor. Kasaba ile aynı isimdeki yetimhane ise ürkütücü hikâyeler ve olaylar ile çevrili. Bu yetimhane, çocukların işkence gördüğü ve acımasız deneylere tabi tutulduğu kötü bir şöhrete sahip. Lost Lullabies da öyküsünü bu konsept üzerine kuruyor. 1960 yılında gizemli bir şekilde yanarak kül olan yetimhane 1980 yılında dört arkadaşın burayı keşfetmek istemesi ile yeniden ziyaret edilir. Bu ziyaret ile birlikte Lowell Yetimhanesi’nin sırları bir bir açığa çıkar. Ruhların peşinde! Lost Lullabies: The Orphanage Chronicles’ın temel oynanış döngüsü yetimhanede kol gezen hayaletleri bulmak üzerine kurulu. Oyuncular çeşitli ekipmanlardan yardım alarak, Lowell Yetimhanesi’ni mesken tutan ruhları durdurmak için öncelikle ruhların geçmişlerini öğrenmesi gerekiyor. Hayaletlerin geçmişine dair detayları bulmak için de bulmacalar çözmeli ve parçaları birleştirmek gerek. Ancak her yanan ve terk edilen binada olduğu gibi Lowell Yetimhanesi’nde de kötücül ruhlar var. Dolayısıyla Lost Lullabies’da iyi hayaletleri kurtarırken kötücül ruhlarla da mücadele etmek lazım. Hayaletlerin türünü belirlemek için çeşitli bir ekipman havuzu da mevcut. Toplamda 24 adet farklı ekipman bulunuyor ve bunlar sayesinde doğru hayaleti bulmaya çalışıyoruz. Ayrıca bu oyunda bir ses etkileşimi de bulunuyor. Hayaletler mikrofonunuzdan aldığı sese göre tepki veriyor ki bu da son dönem korku oyunlarındaki atmosferi daha üst seviyeye taşıyan bir mekanik. Çıkardığınız her ses, sizi ruhlar için bir hedef haline getirebilir. Korku bu kadar güzel görünmemişti Pugsy Studios imzalı Lost Lullabies grafik açısından da odlukça güçlü. Özellikle yetimhane içindeki bazı anlar gerçekten görsel şölen diyebiliriz. Ekipmanlardan çıkan ışıkların duvarlara yansıması ve ay ışığını kırık tahtalar arasından süzmesi oyunun atmosferine harika bir katkı sunmuş. Lost Lullabies: The Orphanage Chronicles ‘ı satın alın ve istek listenize ekleyin. Lost Lullabies: The Orphanage Chronicles, erken erişim sürümü ile oyuncularla buluştu. İster arkadaşlarınızla isterseniz de tek başınıza oynayabilirsiniz. Eğer oyun ilginizi çektiyse, istek listenize ekleyerek stüdyoya destek olabilirsiniz. The post Yetimhane Öyküleri: Lost Lullabies: The Orphanage Chronicles Steam’de Çıktı appeared first on SaveButonu .

title: Bungie Veteran Joseph Cross Appears to No Longer Be Marathon’s Franchise Art Director [UPDATE]
content: Bungie veteran Joseph Cross appears to have stepped away as Marathon’s Franchise Art Director, based on recent LinkedIn and social media changes. Bungie’s upcoming extraction shooter Marathon has slowly been finding its footing again after a rocky year . The studio released a new 22-minute ViDoc giving us a much cleaner, more polished look at the game, along with new dev updates on what’s changed since the early Closed Alpha test. Bungie is now targeting a March 2026 release window for the game. Following its gameplay reveal earlier this year, the game faced heavy criticism from parts of the community, with fans asking for features like proximity chat, solo play, and improved visuals . Bungie has confirmed that proximity chat and solo play option are coming to Marathon, and we already saw a much better look at the exterior environments in the new ViDoc. Image: Bungie Related: Court Dismisses Ex-Marathon Director Chris Barrett’s $200M Lawsuit Against Bungie and Sony But Marathon hasn’t had an easy road since its gameplay reveal earlier this year. The biggest controversy came from the art theft situation , where 1:1 design assets were found in the alpha build of the game that had been used without permission from independent artist Antireal (4nt1r34l). Bungie publicly acknowledged and apologized for the issue at the time, and Antireal later said the dispute has been resolved to her satisfaction . Now, there is a new development that has caught the attention of fans. Joseph Cross Appears to No Longer Be Marathon’s Franchise Art Director It appears that longtime Bungie veteran Joseph Cross may no longer be serving as Marathon’s Franchise Art Director, or may have left Bungie entirely. This information comes from changes spotted on Cross’ LinkedIn profile, where his role as Senior Art Director at Bungie is listed as ending (or ended) sometime in 2025. Cross had held that position since 2018, which is around when Marathon entered development. His long tenure made him one of the key creative figures tied to the project. In addition to LinkedIn, Cross’ public social media presence has also changed. Earlier this year, his X profile bio listed him as “Franchise Art Director, Marathon @ Bungie .” That wording has since been updated to a broader description that reads “Art Director & Artist – Marathon. Dune. Destiny…” with no direct mention of Bungie or a specific leadership role. Update, December 18, 2:03 PM PT: After our report, Kotaku’s Ethan Gach reached out to Joseph Cross. Cross confirmed he left Bungie by choice. “I’m super proud of the project and what the team accomplished over the last six years,” Cross said. Image: X | LinkedIn via The Game Post Related: Destiny 2 Leak Reveals Marathon Crossover Armor Sets and Cosmetics This does not fully confirm that Joseph Cross has left Bungie. It is also possible that he has simply moved into a different position within the studio or stepped away from the Marathon project while remaining at Bungie in another role. The Game Post has reached out to both Joseph Cross and Bungie for comment. We will update this story if we receive a response. As for Marathon itself, Bungie recently announced several changes aimed at addressing player feedback, including improvements to visual clarity, emphasis on “dark sci-fi world” building, and new social features like proximity chat. Image: Bungie Related: Alberto Mielgo defends the Marathon cinematic as “not AI,” denies his team touched Bungie’s plagiarized material and calls the art theft incident a genuine mistake that was “blown out of proportion” What do you think about this potential leadership change and Marathon’s road to release? Let us know your thoughts in the comments below!

title: Sony vs Tencent ‘Horizon Clone’ Lawsuit Over Light of Motiram Ends in Settlement, Game Delisted From Storefronts
content: Sony and Tencent have reached a confidential settlement to end the Light of Motiram “Horizon clone” lawsuit, and it looks like the game has now been delisted from major PC storefronts. Sony and Tencent’s legal battle over Light of Motiram , a game Sony previously described as a Horizon lookalike, appears to have reached its end. The lawsuit, filed by Sony Interactive Entertainment in late July 2025 in a California federal court, accused Tencent and its subsidiaries of copying major elements from the Horizon series, including its world, characters, and overall presentation. Over the last few months, the case turned into a back-and-forth about what counts as inspiration versus copying. Sony pushed hard for an order to stop the game from moving forward, while Tencent ’s side argued Sony was trying to lock up common ideas and style choices in the genre. Image: Tencent | Polaris Quest Related: Tencent pushes to throw out Sony’s Light of Motiram lawsuit, saying it’s “based on future conduct that has not, and may never occur,” and arguing that “fame does not create a trademark” as Sony “fails to identify Aloy’s appearance as a trademark outside the game” Just two weeks ago , things still looked like they were headed toward a bigger showdown in early 2026. The two sides even agreed, on paper, that Tencent would pause promotion and public tests while the legal schedule played out, with the idea that major issues could be heard together in January. Then came a surprising new development. In a new court filing submitted earlier today and obtained by The Game Post , it appears the lawsuit is over. Sony and Tencent End the Light of Motiram Lawsuit According to the filing, Sony and Tencent jointly asked the court to dismiss the case under a rule that allows both sides to end a lawsuit by agreement . The document makes it clear that this decision follows a confidential settlement between all parties involved. The lawsuit has been dismissed with prejudice. That means the case is closed for good , and the same claims cannot be brought back to court later. The filing also confirms that all pending motions have been withdrawn and that each side will cover its own legal costs. Here is the full statement from the court document: “Pursuant to Federal Rule of Civil Procedure and the confidential settlement of all parties, Plaintiff Sony Interactive Entertainment LLC and Defendants Tencent America LLC, Proxima Beta U.S. LLC, Tencent Holdings Ltd., Proxima Beta PTE Ltd., and Tencent Technology (Shanghai) Company Ltd., by and through their undersigned counsel of record, hereby stipulate as follows: “All pending motions are withdrawn and this action is hereby dismissed with prejudice. All parties shall bear their own fees and costs.” Image: Tencent Related: After Sony’s ‘Horizon’ Knock-Off Lawsuit Against Tencent, Light of Motiram Dev Scrubs Store Page, Changing Game Description, Images, and Key Art There is no mention of how much money, if any, changed hands as part of the settlement. The terms are fully confidential, and this was the only court filing submitted today. For now, there is no public record that reveals the actual value of the deal or any specific conditions tied to it. Light of Motiram Gets Delisted from Storefronts Adding another layer to the story, Light of Motiram was also delisted from major storefronts earlier today , just before the court filing appeared. The game’s product pages on both Steam and the Epic Games Store were removed, making it unavailable to view or wishlist on either platform. At the time of writing, the Epic Games Store link leads to a 404 Page Not Found screen. And on Steam , the game’s product page no longer loads a normal product page and instead drops you back onto Steam’s main storefront. As things stand, the lawsuit is finished, the game is no longer listed on major stores, and many questions remain unanswered. Whether Light of Motiram will return in a different form, under a new name, or not at all is something only Tencent can clarify in the future. Image: Sony Related: New PlayStation 6 Handheld Leak Claims Sony Is Prepping “Canis” Through PS5 Power Saver Mode What do you think about how this all ended? Let us know your thoughts in the comments below!

title: PlayStation 5 Pro PSSR 2 Reportedly Doesn’t Have Frame Generation in the Plans
content: A new rumor about PS5 Pro’s PSSR 2 says Sony isn’t planning frame generation. If you’ve been keeping an eye on PS5 Pro news, PSSR 2 has quickly become the big “next year” rumor . The recent leaks claim Sony is working on a major upgrade to its PSSR upscaling for 2026 , with a new approach that’s supposed to look cleaner while using less memory and less GPU time. The chatter also says it would need game updates, since it may rely on a new API instead of being a simple switch. Now, a new round of details has surfaced, and it focuses on one feature some people assumed was coming along for the ride: frame generation. Image: Sony Related: “It’s not some 0.5 upgrade, it’s huge”: New leak claims PS5 Pro will get “PSSR 2” in 2026 using “Multi-Frame Super Resolution 2” to cut memory use and GPU time PS5 Pro PSSR 2 rumor says no frame gen The new comments come from hardware leaker and insider, Moore’s Law Is Dead in a new Broken Silicon episode , where he says he’s relaying what he’s hearing from developer sources and backend documentation. When the discussion turned to frame generation for the next version of PSSR, he shared a message he says came from a source familiar with Sony’s tooling. Here’s what he said: “A source I was talking about this [PSSR 2], then I just asked, ‘is there any reference to frame gen?'” Apparently, the source replied, “not a single one in the next PSSR. I haven’t heard a single developer ask Sony to add Frame Gen to PSSR.” He then follows with:”“not only is Sony not working on it, but they know that developers hate it, hate it, hate it.” The claim is not that frame generation is impossible on PlayStation, but that Sony’s next PSSR 2 upgrade is being treated as an upscaling and image-quality project, not a frame-gen initiative. One possible reason is that frame generation can come with tradeoffs like artifacts and inconsistent motion. Image: Sony Related: New PlayStation 6 handheld leak claims Sony “needs” devs to support PS5 Low Power mode and “maintain 60 FPS by lowering resolutions” to get games ready for launch As for the bigger PSSR 2 package, the earlier rumor set is still the same. The leaks have described PSSR 2 as “MFSR2” internally, with goals like needing fewer inputs, reducing memory use, cutting GPU processing time, and improving image quality versus current PSSR. There’s also talk of Sony shipping better debugging tools for teams, including a replay tool to help track down PSSR artifacting issues. As always, take all of this with a grain of salt. None of it is confirmed by Sony, and “developer sources” can mean anything from early notes to outdated plans. On the PS6 handheld side, the latest rumor says Sony’s new PS5 Power Saver push could be more than just saving electricity . In this same episode, Moore’s Law Is Dead claims a source told him Sony has patched every PS5 dev SDK back to version 1.0 so studios can add Power Saver support even on older builds, and that Sony is treating this as a bigger internal priority than PS5 Pro-specific work. He also points to a CPU optimization doc that allegedly hints at more Low Power modes coming, and says games should be able to run on only 8 CPU threads. The idea is that if PS5 games can reliably run in a lower-power profile, it becomes much easier to carry them over to the rumored PS6 handheld without every game needing a painful custom rewrite. Image: Sony | TCMFGames Related: PlayStation Leak Hints at “Cross-Buy” Feature, Possibly Between PS5, PC, and Rumored PS6 Handheld What do you think? Would you rather Sony focus on making PSSR 2 cleaner and cheaper to run, or do you want frame generation in the mix too?

title: Blizzard Needs to Make Diablo 4's Sanctification System Permanent
content: Season 11 is well underway, the holidays are here, leaderboards are coming soon, and there's a new expansion on the way. There's a lot to look forward to going into the new year for Diablo, but Sanctification is one system that hasn't been announced as a core feature going into the base game. If Blizzard wants to give players a richer itemization, build diversity, and endgame longevity, Sancification needs to stay going forward. Diablo 4's Itemization Problems Gear in Diablo 4 comes in three core flavors: Legendaries, Uniques, and Mythics, but realistically, there isn't much in terms of choice for these items, and the core changes to Tempering and Masterworking in Season have only made them less interesting by removing variance and individuality from gear. For any given build, there is a set of enabling uniques that must be used, full stop. As an example, Death Trap Rogues not equipping Scoundrel's Leathers or Eyes in the Dark would not just make the build worse, it would make the build entirely unplayable. These item slots are essentially "locked" for each build, with no alternatives available. Similarly, Mythics share the same fate. Items such as Harlequin Crest, Shroud of False Death, and Ring of Starless Skies have become staples of many builds, or in the case of Starless Skies, sometimes even build-enabling through the resource cost reduction. With Uniques and Mythics, it is normal, almost expected, that 4-5 item slots are pre-determined, locked in powers with no diversion. In terms of variance and inter-build diversity, gear progression, power-scaling, and even endgame grinds, that only leaves Legendaries to do the heavy lifting of the entire gear system. And yet, Legendaries suffer much the same fate as Uniques and Mythics, with aspects like Vehement Brawler's Aspect being required parts of builds as well. From top to bottom, Diablo 4's gearing is dictated and pre-determined not by gear, but by the guaranteed effects on them. Sanctification as a Solution to Diablo 4's Gearing This is where Sanctification comes in. With the numerous outcomes available to the system, double aspect items, sanctified affixes and more, item slots are no longer "finished" the moment a required piece of the puzzle drops. Gear with Sanctification is more individual, enables gear decisions if certain aspects or mythic powers are added, and gives players something to gamble and work towards. Chasing that perfect piece of gear is one of the great joys of any ARPG, and the base game without Sanctification doesn't have the itemization depth to enable that chase. For the good of the game, Sanctification has to become a core system starting with Season 12.

title: Introducing the Wowhead Architect Tool for Player Housing
content: Wowhead is happy to announce our newest Player Housing tool called Wowhead Architect -- a 3D Model viewer that allows you to import your house and customize it before committing to those changes in game! Wowhead Architect Alpha for Player Housing We recommend having Hardware Acceleration turned on when using the feature. Wowhead Architect Tool We're happy to announce our Wowhead Architect tool for Player Housing. This tool is currently in an Alpha state, and there are more features currently planned in the future. If you have any bugs, please let us know. Features You can use the Wowhead Architect tool to plan your house exactly how you want it, before making those changes in game. Don't forget that there are a lot more decor items coming in Midnight as well, and you can preview how those decor items will look in your house using our tool so when Midnight launches, you can know exactly what decor items you need and can quickly replicate it. There are many features currently available in the Wowhead Architect tool: An open sandbox Model Viewer - build a house to look exactly how you want it. Pick and place decor items - exactly like you would in game. Import your house - Move your decor around to where it looks best without doing permanent moves in game. Import a friends' house - For inspiration or to see what items they used and how things are set up. Preview dyes - To see what color matches your room perfectly before committing gold to it. Save and Load - Want to take a break? Save and load your house at a later time to continue working on it. Preview We recently previewed Hippo's house and we imported this into our Architect tool and have some preview screenshots below! Coming Soon There are more features planned including: House Import Selection - Currently we only import the first house for a character, but characters can have multiple different houses! We will add support to choose which house to import for the character. Additional Customizations - Customizing walls, ceilings, and floors is also on our list. We want to match what you can do in-game as much as we can. Support for Live - Currently, Wowhead Architect is only available on our Midnight Beta database. We definitely want to support it on Live as soon as we can, so you can see the decor available in-game right now. UI/UX Enhancements - We'll continue to polish this UI, fix any bugs or odd behaviors, and add things from in-game. For example, adding the tag support in the decor picker is on our list. In-Game Limits - Building a house in a sandbox is fun, but maybe you're trying to plan your in-game build. We plan to add support for decor/room weight counters and limits, and importing your in-game acquired decor list, as an option. And more! If there's any other features you'd like to see, please check out the comments below!

title: Legion Remix Ends January 19th - Buy Remaining Bronze Rewards and Finish Achievements
content: Blizzard has confirmed that Legion Remix will end on January 19th. Legion Remix: RewardsDecor Farming in Legion Remix Legion Remix Ends January 19th Legion Remix now has an confirmed end date of January 19th with many of the rewards and benefits of the event no longer being available. This infographic confirms that Legion Remix will end with the Midnight Pre-Patch alongside AoTC and CE achievement, the Keystone Legend achievement for Season 3, and PvP Gladiator achievements. There are many benefits and rewards in Legion Remix that you should consider farming before it goes away in a month! Leveling Speed You can level a fresh level 80 character super fast in Legion Remix, especially with stackable experience bonuses and the recent nerfs to experience needed from 70 to 80. Legion Remix Rewards Here are some of the highlights of the rewards that you probably want from the event before it goes away!: Legion Remix: Rewards Sargerei Transmogs: 4 unique transmog sets are exclusive to Legion Remix, and contains a very unique cape model in the game. The Fel Order Hall mounts: 12 fel version of the Order Hall mounts are available in Legion Remix. You can level up each class to get it for free, or you can buy them from the vendor for 20k Bronze. The Druid mount is also a new flight form. Unique mounts: 33 brand new remix mounts are available to add to your collection. From the Ilidari Dreadstalker to the Arcberry Manasaber, there are lots of mounts here to add to your stables. If you’re missing mounts from Legion, this is also a great time to get some rarer or unobtainable mounts like the Gul’dan Infernals or the Violet Spellwing, the old AOTC mount. Naxt Victim: This achievement is near impossible on live servers, but is much easier on Legion Remix with people farming the Sentinax. If you want this achievement, head over to the Sentinax now and click here for more details. Balance of Power: The Balance of Power quest chain is much easier in Legion Remix. Many of the timegating elements and odd quests have been removed, and you have an overpowered character for many of the steps. Don’t forget this achievement is Warband wide meaning you only need to do this once for all your characters. Hidden Artifact Appearances: If you’re missing some of the hidden artifact appearances, many of them are much easier. You can buy some directly off a vendor, special events like the Withered Army Training and Raid Bosses have a daily lockout and World bosses spawn much more frequently. Don’t forget that the first time you unlock a Hidden Artifact on a class, you get a decor item as well. Dungeon Portals: 5 of the Legion Mythic+ teleports are now available from Mythic+ dungeons. If you’ve wanted the ability to portal to Legion now is the time to get them as who knows if any of these dungeons will ever come back to Mythic+. Special Weapons:Many special weapons are much easier to get in Legion Remix such as Taeshalach and the Argus Scythes. Complete the Mythic raids twice and you’ll have enough to be the proud owner of your new weapons that look super cool!

title: Warlocks Can Now Unlock the Power of Fel Magic in Mists of Pandaria Classic
content: Warlocks, masters of the Fel, have long wanted a way to make their fire spells match the energies they harness and wield in combat. In the original release of Mists of Pandaria, a new questline was introduced to reward players with this unique customization. Isle of Thunder Zone Guide Much like the Benediction questline for Priests, or the Rhok'delar, Longbow of the Ancient Keepers challenges for Hunters back in Classic, the The Codex of Xerrath questline for Warlocks in Mists of Pandaria (now returning in Mists of Pandaria Classic) will challenge you to make full use of the Warlock class' kit and utility, and require quite a bit of skill (and a bit of luck) to succeed. Starting the quest You'll begin your quest by looting a Sealed Tome of the Lost Legion from rare mobs in the Isle of Thunder. The drop rate for the tome is relatively low, but with some persistence, you can score one eventually. If you're not inclined to grind, you may also find it at your local Auction House. Keep in mind that the tome is only lootable by Warlocks, and any Warlock that tags an Isle of Thunder rare can potentially loot it, but only one tome drops per rare, and only one Warlock will get it from that kill (the loot is pre-assigned, so it doesn't matter how fast you loot the corpse; only the assigned Warlock will be able to see it or loot it). Look for Jubeka's Mark at the entrance of the Black Temple to start the final Scenario. Once you obtain it, you should be able to follow the questline, which starts with An Unusual Tome. As you follow the chain (no spoilers here, sorry!), you will learn about the mysterious Council of the Black Harvest, and ultimately travel to the Black Temple, Illidan's former seat of power. The Solo Challenge The last quest, Infiltrating the Black Temple leads you to one of WoW's most memorable solo challenges: Kanrethad Ebonlocke. This encounter is more about proper execution than it is about raw item level, as Kanrethad has a lot of abilities that need to be reacted to, and proper use of your skills is required to succeed. "Say hello to my little friend!" While obviously a higher item level (closer to 522+ at least) will make the fight easier, it is definitely possible to complete it with an item level as low as 489 and even lower. It is advised that if you're trying this at a lower item level, to bring plenty of combat consumables (flasks, food, potions) and a few Purification Potions to deal with Kanrethad's Curse of Ultimate Doom if it comes to that (this is the fight's "enrage" timer). Power! Unlimited (Fel) Power As a reward for your efforts, once you defeat and banish the infamous Leader of the Black Harvest, you'll be able to learn The Codex of Xerrath, which has various cosmetic effects that are better experienced than spoiled. While the changes are more obvious to Destruction players (as they have more Fire spells), every specialization will see changes in its spells. Should you wish to go back to a life of non-green fire (and really, who would want that?), you'll find Jubeka Shadowbreaker in Shadowmoon Valley, where she can rid you of the Fel awesomeness burden for the low sum of . Should you wish to become awesome tainted by Fel magic again, simply interact with the banished Kanrethad. Did you defeat Kanrethad in the original Mists of Pandaria release or in MoP Classic? How many attempts did it take? Let us know in the comments down below!

title: AOTC and Cutting Edge Achievements Will Be Unavailable with Pre-Patch - What To Do Before the Midnight Pre-Patch
content: Blizzard has detailed everything going away with the Midnight Pre-Patch! While CE and AOTC achievements are being removed, the mount drop rates will not be lowered until Midnight launches on March 2nd The War Within storyline is winding down to its conclusion as we approach the beginning of World of Warcraft’s next chapter in Midnight. Before we turn the page on your next adventures, you’ll want to complete activities from around Khaz Algar before many of their rewards are no longer available when the pre-expansion content update goes live and The War Within Season Three ends on January 20. The War Within Season Three Raids The following Season Three rewards and achievements will no longer be attainable: Ahead of the Curve: Dimensius, the All-Devouring (Feat of Strength): Defeat Dimensius, the All-Devouring on Heroic difficulty or higher before the release of the next raid tier. Cutting Edge:Dimensius, the All-Devouring (Feat of Strength): Defeat Dimensius, the All-Devouring on Mythic difficulty before the release of the next raid tier. Upper Left: Royal Voidwing Lower Right: Unbound Star-Eater While the Royal Voidwing and Unbound Star-Eater mounts won’t be going away with the pre-expansion content update, the Royal Voidwing earned from completing the quest “A Twilight Oath’s End” will no longer be earnable with the launch of Midnight on March 2. The drop chance of the Unbound Star-Eater and other Mythic Raid mounts will decrease significantly with Midnight's launch. Mythic+ The Mythic+ leaderboards will lock at 10:00 pm PST the night before maintenance in each region—January 19 at 10:00 pm PST for NA / January 20 at 22:00 CET for EU. With the season’s end, ratings that qualify for the 0.1% “the Unbound Hero” title and achievement will be recorded. The title will be rewarded in the following weeks after the season ends. PvP Astral Gladiator's Fel Bat The current season of PvP content will end at 10:00 pm PST the night before maintenance in each region—January 19 at 10:00 pm PST for NA / January 20 at 22:00 CET for EU. With the season’s end, it will no longer be possible to earn PvP seasonal rewards, titles, or The War Within Season Three rankings, and titles will be awarded in the weeks after the season ends: Astral Gladiator: The War Within Season 3 (Feat of Strength): End The War Within Season 3 in the top 0.1% of the 3v3 arena ladder (requires 150 games won in The War Within Season 3). Rewards the title “Astral Gladiator”. Astral Legend: The War Within Season 3 (Feat of Strength): End The War Within Season 3 in the top 0.1% of the Solo Shuffle ladder. Players can still queue for rated PvP modes for Honor, Conquest, and progress toward the faction-themed Vicious Void Creeper mount for Horde or Alliance. The following rated PvP rewards can only be earned during The War Within Season Three and will no longer be available once the season ends: Astral Gladiator’s Fel Bat mount: "Awakened from caves in the battlefield, and armored to the fray.” Arcane Weapon Illusion The War Within Season Three PvP Elite Weapon and Transmog Set Titles: Combatant: Get a 1000 Rating Challenger: Get a 1400 Rating Rival: Get a 1800 Rating Duelist: Get a 2100 Rating Gladiator: 50 wins at 2400 Rating Complete Legion Remix Before January 20 Glide into fast frenetic fun in Legion Remix as you meet up with the infinite dragonflight once more, level new characters, and earn a variety of items to add to your collection. As the Legion Remix timeline begins collapsing, say your goodbyes and embrace the chaos. Learn more in our previously published article. World of Warcraft®: Midnight™ launching worldwide on March 2, 2026, at 3:00 pm PST. Players who have purchased any edition of the Midnight expansion can secure Housing Early Access now!

title: Blizzard, Where Is The Festive Housing Decor?
content: The Holidays are fast approaching, and decorations have gone up all around the world. For player housing, however, the Winter Veil Tree is missing. With the Winter Veil Tree datamined weeks ago, it stood to reason that holiday decor would become available before Christmas, but that doesn't seem to be the case anymore. Christmas is just a few days away, Winter Veil is well underway in-game, but it remains unknown how to obtain the special tree. Festive holiday decor would be a great addition to player housing. It could be used to celebrate everything from birthdays with special cakes to Christmas or even more regional holidays, such as the 4th of July, which could have outdoor fireworks. At the end of the day, if festive decorations are going to work, Blizzard needs to give players their decorations in advance, rather than after the fact, when all the festivities are already over. Where is the Winter Veil Tree? The most likely source for the tree is as a present under Greatfather Winter's tree, which can be opened starting December 25th. This does however make for a bit of an awkward timing, as players would be receiving holiday decorations after the holidays. Some more outlandish ideas for the tree's drop source include it being part of the endeavour system or being added to a vendor via a hotfix, both of which seem unlikely given that Winter Veil Tree is named after Winter Veil. Getting Creative for Christmas Players instead have resorted to making their own trees, such as Reddit User Lexiconn, who spent a whole afternoon setting up a massive tree in their main room. Lexiconn made sure to include all the details in their tree, including presents! Sadly for players that aren't willing to spend hours making a tree from scratch, Blizzard has provided very little in the way of information regarding the Winter Veil Tree decor item.

title: Even More Buffs Coming to Arms Warrior on China's Titan Reforged Server
content: Blizzard and NetEase have announced additional changes to Arms Warrior on China's Titan Reforged server. These changes are intended to improve the attack speed scaling and overall damage output for Arms Warriors. Restoration Druid Healing Buffs Massive Buffs to Arms Warrior After the weekly maintenance on December 25, we will be making the following adjustments to Arms Warriors on the Titan Reforged server: Time: Warrior Changes Arms: Wrecking Crew Damage bonus increased to 4/8/12/16/20% (up from 3/6/9/12/15%) Blood Frenzy Attack speed bonus increased to 10/20% (up from 5/10%) Bladestorm Now deals 115% weapon damage (down from 125%) Can now hit up to 6 targets Deals 30% additional damage to the nearest target. This results in a total of 149.5% weapon damage to the nearest target Developer’s Notes: The goal of these changes is to improve attack speed scaling and overall damage output for Arms Warriors, while also giving Bladestorm greater flexibility so it can effectively serve both single-target and multi-target scenarios. To achieve this, we increased Bladestorm’s target cap while slightly reducing its base damage coefficient, and introduced a key new mechanic: Bladestorm now deals additional damage to the nearest target. With these adjustments, Bladestorm should feel more impactful in both single-target and AoE combat, without becoming overly dominant in multi-target situations. It also introduces an interesting positional decision for the Warriors—standing closer to a priority target to deal increased damage. "For the Burning Blade!"

title: New Training Grounds Quest Drops Hero-Track Jewelry in Midnight
content: A new PvP quest for the PvP Training Grounds in Midnight will drop a piece of Hero-track Jewelry of the player's choice! Early Morning Training Quest The quest requires players to complete 3 Battlegrounds matches. These matches can be completed in the new Training Grounds playlist, which features PvP combat against AI-bots instead of real players. Taking inspiration from Comp Stomp, Training Grounds gives players a smoother introduction to WoW PvP. If players are not interested in playing against bots, they can also complete the quest against real players. The reward for completing this quest is the player's choice of a ring or necklace at item level 259 on the Hero-track. For gearing purposes, this quest becomes extremely valuable, considering players don't need to complete PvP matches against real players.

title: Earn Powerful Rewards with Diablo 4's New Hidden Boss Fight
content: Diablo 4 Season 11 has been hiding a secret from everyone: a new boss fight that is only accessible through a set of altars throughout Sanctuary. Dropping rewards that include a Resplendent Spark, this is something players will definitely want to do at some point! Purified Essences and Altars In Diablo 4 Season 11 To activate the boss fight, players will need to bring a set of purified essences to the corresponding altars. For example, the Purified Horn of Duriel drops from both the lair boss Duriel encounter as well as the new helltide boss version of Duriel. This must be turned in to the Altar of Pain, located in Kehjistan. The full list of altars and their essences is as follows: Altar of Pain Located in Kehjistan to the northwest of the Deshar Waypoint. The Altar of Pain is where players can turn in the Purified Horn of Duriel. Altar of Lies Located in Fractured Peak to the east of the Bear Tribe Refuge Waypoint, the Altar of Lies is where players can turn in the Purified Eye of Belial. Altar of Anguish Located in Nahantu to the southwest of the Kurast Docks Waypoint, the Altar of Anguish is where players can turn in the Purified Claw of Andariel. Altar of Sin Located in Hawezar between Zarbinzet and the Ruins of Rakhat Keep, the Altar of Sins is where players can turn in the Purified Tongue of Azmodan. Hidden Boss Fight and Rewards After turning in the purified essences to all four altars, a portal will open, taking you to the special boss encounter with the lesser evils. Defeating them drops the following loot: One Resplendent Spark One Tribute of Ascendance Various Assorted Runes A large amount of Uniques The Shield Crest of Exile mount trophy cosmetic

title: New House Levels and Rewards Datamined - Increased Decor Budgets and Medium-Size Exteriors
content: With Housing being all the craze on live servers right now, it seems that Blizzard isn't quite done with its features for Midnight. We've datamined brand-new Housing levels, with rewards that expand decor budgets and introduce new medium-size house exteriors! New House Level Rewards Level: NEW 7 Name: Room and Decor Placement Budget Bonuses Description: Gain an additional 10 Room Placement Budget and 500 Decor Placement Budget at this level. Level: NEW 8 Name: Medium-Size House Exteriors Description: You may now use medium-size house exteriors for your house. Level: NEW 9 Name: Room and Decor Placement Budget Bonuses Description: Gain an additional 10 Room Placement Budget and 500 Decor Placement Budget at this level. What does this mean? First, it means that Blizzard is still actively tweaking Housing for its actual launch with Midnight. These new rewards mean expanded possibilities for interiors while hinting at changes coming for exteriors, as we hadn't heard of medium-size house exteriors until now. This change might mean new exterior-exclusive decor or options to make decor larger when used in exteriors, meaning you wouldn't need to use all your budget in rocks when building a cave, for instance. However, this is pure speculation.

title: New Profession Titles in Midnight - Earn Thalassian Titles
content: Blizzard has added new titles to professions in Midnight. Completing two achievements per profession will unlock a new Thalassian profession title for your characters. Thalassian Profession Titles in Midnight Each profession has a title in Midnight, all formatted "Thalassian x". To earn these titles, you must complete each profession's Dedicated to Craft achievement, for instance: The achievement requires you to reach max level in that profession for their Midnight category and complete 50 crafting orders, or 4 profession weekly quests for gathering, for that profession. For instance, Dedicated to the Craft: Inscription requires you to complete Inscribing at Midnight and Inscription-on-Demand.

title: Platinum Challenge Mode Season 2 Rewards - Mists of Pandaria Classic
content: If you found that Challenge Modes weren't quite challenging enough when MoP Classic launched, you might enjoy the updates that came with Phase 3. While there was no actual increase in difficulty, there are now rewards for completing the Challenge Modes in even faster times than Gold. Challenge Mode Rewards Guide Platinum Achievements & Toys Before you say "an achievement isn't really a reward", let's just clarify that the achievements come with a toy. If you complete the Temple of the Jade Serpent Challenge Mode dungeon in Platinum time, you will earn the Temple of the Jade Serpent: Platinum achievement, which also comes with the Platinum Boots of Expeditious Retreat toy. Dungeon Achievement Toy Temple of the Jade Serpent: Platinum Platinum Boots of Expeditious Retreat Stormstout Brewery: Platinum Platinum "Little Ale" Gate of the Setting Sun: Platinum Platinum Rod of Ambershaping Shado-Pan Monastery: Platinum Platinum Potion of Invisibility Siege of Niuzao Temple: Platinum Platinum Amber Mogu'shan Palace: Platinum Platinum Battle Horn Scholomance: Platinum Platinum Vial of Polyformic Acid Scarlet Halls: Platinum Platinum Battle Banner Scarlet Monastery: Platinum Platinum Sacrificial Dagger Each dungeon rewards its own unique toy, and these toys can only be used inside Challenge Mode dungeons. Most of these toys are versions of commonly used items in Challenge Modes, such as the rocket boots linked above, or the Platinum Potion of Invisibility. Platinum Coins: Mounts, Pets, Toys, & Transmog In addition to an achievement, completing a Challenge Mode dungeon in Platinum time will earn you 3 Platinum Coins. Important to note, you earn coins every time you complete a dungeon in Platinum time, not just the first time. Item Type Price Eye of the Legion Pet 5 Platinum Coins Instant Statue Pedestal Toy 5 Platinum Coins Demon Hunter's Aspect Toy 5 Platinum Coins Swift Yak Pelt Toy 0 Platinum Coins Reins of the Ashen Pandaren Phoenix Mount 0 Platinum Coins Reins of the Crimson Pandaren Phoenix Mount 0 Platinum Coins Reins of the Violet Pandaren Phoenix Mount 0 Platinum Coins Reins of the Emerald Pandaren Phoenix Mount 0 Platinum Coins Magic Rooster Egg Mount 0 Platinum Coins Wooly White Rhino Mount 0 Platinum Coins Tabard of Brilliance Tabard 0 Platinum Coins Tabard of the Void Tabard 0 Platinum Coins Tabard of Fury Tabard 0 Platinum Coins Recolored Challenge Mode Pieces Transmog 5 Platinum Coins Per Piece 0 Platinum Coins Full Set These coins can then be used to buy mounts, tabards, toys, a pet, and recolored versions of the original Gold Challenge Mode sets. The mounts consist of two previously TCG-exclusive mounts, the Magic Rooster Egg and Wooly White Rhino, as well as all of the Silver Challenge Mode Phoenix mounts. The tabards, toys, and pets are also all previously TCG-exclusive items. Jaelof Ironhart To purchase all items you will need 465 coins (only counting 3 Phoenix mounts, since you will have earned one of them from the Silver achievement, and only one recolored transmog set), which means you would need to complete 155 Challenge Mode dungeons in Platinum time. Viktor Felhallow Alliance NPC on the top, Horde NPC on the bottom. The vendors are located in the faction Shrines, and they are Jaelof Ironhart for Alliance players, and Viktor Felhallow for the Horde. They are on the upper levels of the Shrines. Season 2 Rewards In addition to these Platinum awards, there will be rewards for players who complete all Challenge Mode dungeons in an "exceptionally fast time". While similar to arena titles, for example, this will not be a percentage of players, but rather a set time for each dungeon. The times have not yet been announced, but the reward will be the Mistborne achievement, which comes with the title, and the Reins of the Black Kor'kron Proto-drake mount. Please note, in the database the achievement currently lists the Reins of the Celestial Riding Serpent as the mount reward, but in a recent news post it was announced that it has been replaced by the Reins of the Black Kor'kron Proto-drake. The mount is a previously unavailable recolor of the Reins of Galakras. Do these updates and new rewards make you more interested in Challenge Mode dungeons? Is there a specific item that you have your eyes on? Let us know in the comments down below!

title: Best Infinite Power Farms in Legion Remix - Empower Your Timerunner
content: With Legion Remix wrapping up after the holidays, let's take a look at some of the best ways to give your timerunner that extra oomph before the timeways collapse. Sentinax Farms Similar to Bronze Farms, Sentinax continues to reign supreme for raw Infinite Power grinds. Its main benefit being a farm that anyone can participate regardless of gear level. You can check our highlight in this standalone article, but the idea is to concentrate one group (ideally more) under the Sentinax and spam all its portals. You should use the group finder to find others interested in this farm, as there are usually a couple happening at all times. Note that, while rewarding, it can be a very boring farm. However, a good farm if you want to catch up on your favorite show or want to watch a new movie. Daily Raid Runs The og Infinite Power farm. While not a "farm" in the strict sense, it is still worthwhile to do. Farming raids daily has been a staple of Legion Remix, and it still rewards a plethora of Infinite Power every day, both from raw drops and from gathering 100s of Fragmented Memento of Epoch Challenges. While you can run each Legion raid once a day in each difficulty, for Infinite Power purposes, most players will stick with doing only Heroic and Mythic or only Mythic, as the gains reduce significantly on lower difficulties. Once again, Group Finder is your friend. There are hundreds of players running Legion raids daily, so even if you don't have the best geared character, you might be able to sneak into a run for Mythic raids. Mythic+ If you have a group of 3 to 5, Mythic+ might be the best way to farm for you. The idea here is to run lower keys that any of you can solo quickly and split-run them to complete it even faster. For instance, if you can solo +40, maybe try +30s for speed. The goal is to accumulate as many Fragmented Memento of Epoch Challenges as fast as you can from these keys. Remember to drop your key after each dungeon to keep the speedrun train going. The best keys for this method are keys like Eye of Azshara or Arcway that allow players to do bosses in any order, while keys like Darkheart Thicket or Neltharion's Lair don't really benefit from bringing more players along due to their linear design.

title: Majority of Addon Changes Finalized for Midnight Pre-Patch - Whitelisted Spells Detailed
content: Following up on the intent to loosen API restrictions shared earlier this week, Blizzard has released a list of whitelisted spells and API changes for the Midnight pre-patch, noting that the majority of future addon changes will be going into Patch 12.0.1 instead. These newly whitelisted spells are broken into two categories, with some being flagged to show just their cooldowns and others having all of their data visible. While all players can benefit from more easily customizing their Dragonriding ability's shared cooldowns, the change to Maelstrom Weapon and Void Metamorphosis information fills a critical informational hole for those specialization. These changes allow addons to track Maelstrom charges, a crucial aspect to playing Enhancement Shaman that isn't well supported by native tools. The other critical piece of information in this release is that the majority of future addon changes beyond those outlined below will be going into Patch 12.0.1, which launches a few weeks after the Pre-Patch. This means that players may need to find some creative solutions for issues not yet addressed as they re-customize their user interface, though the pre-patch is generally the best time for this transition, as players are also adjusting to other class, spec, and game-wide changes. Blizzard again! This week the first PTR build (PTR 1) for Midnight went up. As mentioned before, PTR is now 12.0.0 and all remaining Beta builds are 12.0.1. Below are the changes that are in PTR 1 that were not in Beta 5. It's important to note that ALL changes in PTR builds will also be in Beta, so expect to see these changes in Beta 6 as well when that goes up in January. After this build the majority of our addon changes will be going into 12.0.1 instead of 12.0.0 (we are very close to RC for 12.0.0) but there will be a few things that do go into 12.0.0 as well (mostly very high priority things). New Changes in PTR 1 (will also be in Beta 6) Whitelisting Select Spells The following spells have been flagged as having non-secret cooldowns: 425782 - Second Wind 372608 - Surge Forward 372610 - Skyward Ascent 403092 - Aerial Halt 361584 - Whirling Surge 418592 - Lightning Rush 460002 - Switch Flight Style 61304 - GCD Dummy Spell The following spells have been flagged as having non-secret aura data: 377234 - Thrill of the Skies 388367 - Ohn'ahra's Gusts 418590 - Static Charge 369968 - Skyriding Racing 344179 - Maelstrom Weapon 1217607 - Void Metamorphosis 1225789 - Void Metamorphosis (resource aura) 1227702 - Collapsing Star Combat Res Cooldowns All combat res spells now have non-secret cooldowns and charge counts. Reload UI & Secrets We have fixed an issue where secret values were made non-secret following a reload ui. Removing Old Duration APIs We have removed the follow APIs (addons should use the new Duration Object type instead from now on): C_ActionBar.GetActionCooldownRemaining, C_ActionBar.GetActionCooldownRemainingPercent C_Spell.GetSpellCooldownRemaining, C_Spell.GetSpellCooldownRemainingPercent C_UnitAuras.GetAuraDurationRemaining, C_UnitAuras.GetAuraDurationRemainingPercent Duration Object Utilities Added 2 new APIs to Duration Bbjects: EvaluateRemainingDuration(curve, modifier), EvaluateElapsedDuration(curve, modifier) Generic Boolean To Color APIs Added 2 new APIs (C_CurveUtil.EvaluateColorFromBoolean and C_CurveUtil.EvaluateColorValueFromBoolean) that can be used to convert a secret boolean to a color.

title: What's New With Celestial Dungeons in Mists of Pandaria Classic Phase 3
content: Mists of Pandaria Classic Phase 3 is firmly upon us, and that means the second season of Celestial Dungeons is now underway! In keeping with the Phase theme this season, you can expect to find your Celestial Dungeons influenced by Lei-Shen, but never fear, your buffs have been buffed to help you combat this. Celestial Dungeon Guide New Player Blessings BuffEffect Blessing of Yu'lon Your Intellect is increased by 15%. Your Stamina is increased by 5%. Damaging spells and abilities inflict Jadefire, burning the target for 15000 over 10 sec and increasing their magic damage taken by 3%. This can occur once every 4 seconds and can stack up to 5 times. And in Phase 3, an avatar of Yu'lon will breathe Jadefire on nearby enemies and amplify all Magic damage done by players for a short duration Blessing of Niuzao Your Stamina is increased by 20%. Your Strength, Agility, and Intellect are increased by 10%. Dodge, Parry, and Blocks increase your Stamina by 6% and your Strength, Agility, and Intellect by 4%. This effect lasts 20 seconds and can stack up to 20 times. And in Phase 3, an avatar of Niuzao will cause an earthquake, repeatedly stunning nearby enemies and increasing all Physical damage they take for a short duration. Blessing of Chi-JiYour Intellect and Stamina is increased by 10%. Healing spells and abilities recite a blazing song around your ally that increases their Movement Speed by 50%, heals nearby allies for 30000, and burns nearby enemies for 30000 Fire damage every 2 seconds for 15 sec. This can occur once every 30 seconds. And in Phase 3, an avatar will bestow a weakened version of Blazing Song to all allies. Blessing of Xuen Your Strength and Agility are increased by 15%. Direct attacks unleash an echo of Xuen's ferocity. A bolt of lightning is hurled at the enemy, dealing 20,000 Nature Damage, and then jumps to nearby enemies. This can occur once every 3 seconds. And in Phase 3, an avatar of Xuen will create a lightning vortex at its location, pulling all nearby enemies to its location and granting all allies a weakened version of Spectral Ferocity. Additional Boss Abilities Might of the Thunder King Enemies in the Celestial Dungeons will have the following buffs. Damage increased by 35% Health increased by 125% Lightning Traps: Players will need to avoid cycling lightning traps throughout the dungeons. Thunderstorms: All dungeons will experience new weather as a powerful thunderstorm takes over. Summon the Storm: Every 60 seconds, a boss is influenced by Lei Shen, the Thunder King, and will use one of the 3 new lightning-based abilities. Our full Celestial Dungeon guide has now been updated for Season 2, with new vendor details and item costs. Are you having fun running Celestial Dungeons this Phase? title: Unobtainable Legion Pre-Patch Achievement Returns for Remix - It All Makes Sense Now
content: Missed out on the original Legion Pre-Patch events? With the return of capital city Doomsayers in Legion Remix, Timerunners can acquire the previously unobtainable It All Makes Sense Now achievement once again. Legion Remix OverviewLegion Remix: Rewards It All Makes Sense Now Doomsayer Achievement Returns Previously only available during the Legion expansion, the limited-time It All Makes Sense Now pre-patch feat of strength is once again obtainable on Legion Remix but only for the remainder of the event. Only the old achievement is obtainable, there is not a new one specifically for Legion Remix. Doomsayers throughout Stormwind and Orgimmar peddle their propaganda foretelling unspeakable ruin. Simply speak to a Doomsayer to obtain a special pamphlet. Collect all 12 pamphlets total to be awarded the achievement. Tips & Tricks Since the pamphlets are unique, keeping previous ones until you've collected all 12 ensures you won't receive duplicates. There is a 15-minute cooldown for collecting a pamphlet. You can bypass this cooldown upon dying. Good luck collecting this achievement of the past, Timerunners! Be sure to check out our full list of Legion Remix Rewards as well as our Legion Remix decor farming guide for more collection opportunities. Legion Remix: RewardsDecor Farming in Legion Remix

title: Will 2026 Be Blizzard's Biggest Year? Variety Interview With Blizzard President Johanna Faries
content: With their 35th anniversary coming up, 2026 is set to be a big year for Blizzard Entertainment. One way that Blizzard is planning on celebrating this milestone is through the return of BlizzCon in September. Earlier this week, Variety sat down with Blizzard's President, Johanna Faries, to discuss why players should be excited about what's next. Johanna Faries Interview With Variety Johanna Faries The teams across Blizzard entirely, as an organization, are gearing up for what we hope to be the biggest year yet for Blizzard, and we take that statement very seriously. Diablo During the Game Awards, Blizzard announced the latest expansion coming to Diablo 4 - Lord of Hatred. Set to release on April 28th, Johanna Faries describes this reveal as "a kickstart to this huge 2026 for Blizzard." In addition to the latest Diablo 4 expansion, Faries also highlights that 2026 will be the Diablo franchise’s 30th anniversary, so could there be even more surprises in store? World of Warcraft WoW's latest expansion, Midnight, is set to launch on March 2nd, with the pre-patch event beginning on January 20th. In addition to the pre-patch event, players will also be able to play the new Devourer Demon Hunter Specialisation and create the latest Class/Race combination with Void Elf Demon Hunters! Overwatch While Blizzard Entertainment and the Diablo franchise will be celebrating milestone anniversaries in 2026, the year will also mark the 10th Anniversary of the Overwatch franchise! BlizzCon 2026 is the first year that BlizzCon will return since 2023. Johanna Faries states that the team is not only excited for the event itself, but for what is to come even before BlizzCon in September. Blizzard's President states that 2024 and 2025 were skipped to "give our employees time to put on the best show possible for our community.” BlizzCon 2026 announcement trailer While Faries states that they have taken notes from what leadership has presented at previous BlizzCon events, she hopes to bring in new ideas and surprises for the fans of Blizzard Entertainment. Johanna Faries We really think about, what would speak to our fans? What do they want to see? What’s bread and butter expectation? What are the surprises that we can bring? How do we expand the scope of what BlizzCon can be? What are you most looking forward to in 2026? Let us know your thoughts in the comments down below!
